summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between U.S. prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and UK attorney Jill Greenfield regarding arranging an interview with Greenfield's client, a potential victim witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistical details, the client's conditions for the interview, and reveal the client had made a complaint to the Met police about a sexual assault by Epstein while in London and employed by Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.role: Attorney representing a potential victim witness
persons.context: Partner at Fieldfisher law firm in London, representing a client who is a potential victim witness in the Epstein investigation. She communicates with U.S. prosecutors about arranging an interview with her client.

persons.name: Louise Scott
persons.context: Executive assistant at Fieldfisher law firm who handles scheduling and logistics for calls and meetings between attorney Jill Greenfield and the U.S. prosecutors.

persons.name: Kyle Philips
persons.context: Another partner at the Fieldfisher law firm who is mentioned as being in attendance for a scheduled call regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. The emails reference a client's complaint to the Met police regarding a sexual assault by Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'G Maxwell'. The client's complaint states the assault occurred while she was 'in the employment of G Maxwell.' Prosecutors express interest in learning about instructions from Maxwell.

connections.description: Greenfield is the legal representative for a client who is a potential victim witness in the Epstein case.
The client made a complaint to the Met police regarding a sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein.
The client was allegedly in the employment of Ghislaine Maxwell at the time of the reported assault by Epstein.
Both work at the Fieldfisher law firm, with Scott serving as Greenfield's executive assistant.
Both are partners at the Fieldfisher law firm and are copied on correspondence regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Proposed Interview Meeting in London
events.description: A potential meeting date was proposed for U.S. prosecutors to travel to London to interview Jill Greenfield's client.

events.title: Scheduled Call to Discuss Investigation
events.description: A call was scheduled for Thursday, July 9, 2020, at 2 PM UK time between U.S. prosecutors and attorneys Jill Greenfield and Kyle Philips to discuss the Epstein investigation and the client interview.

events.title: Client's Complaint to Met Police
events.description: Jill Greenfield's client made a complaint to the London Metropolitan Police regarding a sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein that occurred while she was in London and employed by Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A potential victim witness, represented by UK attorney Jill Greenfield, had made a formal complaint to the London Metropolitan Police (Met) regarding a sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein.
The assault reportedly occurred while the client was in London and was 'in the employment of G Maxwell' (Ghislaine Maxwell).
U.S. prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively seeking to interview this witness as part of their Epstein investigation as of February-July 2020.
The witness set specific conditions for an interview, including a two-part meeting and the presence of a US-based friend/lawyer, indicating sensitivity and caution.
Logistical planning for the interview was complicated by the COVID-19 pandemic, which prevented international travel for the prosecutors.
